name: Device
description: A type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device.

properties.name: Device
properties.definition: A type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
properties.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

properties.name: meta
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
properties.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
properties.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

properties.name: text
properties.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
properties.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
properties.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

properties.name: contained
properties.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
properties.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: identifier
properties.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.
properties.comment: The barcode string from a barcode present on a device label or package may identify the instance, include names given to the device in local usage, or may identify the type of device. If the identifier identifies the type of device, Device.type element should be used.

properties.name: definition
properties.short: The reference to the definition for the device
properties.definition: The reference to the definition for the device.

properties.name: udiCarrier
properties.definition: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package.  Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
properties.comment: UDI may identify an unique instance of a device, or it may only identify the type of the device.  See [UDI mappings](device-mappings.html#udi) for a complete mapping of UDI parts to Device.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. properties.name: deviceIdentifier
properties.definition: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

properties.name: issuer
properties.definition:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

properties.name: jurisdiction
properties.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is  http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.

properties.name: carrierAIDC
properties.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
properties.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

properties.name: carrierHRF
properties.definition: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.
properties.comment: If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

properties.name: entryType
properties.definition: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

properties.name: status
properties.definition: Status of the Device availability.
properties.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes inactive and entered-in-error that mark the device (record)as not currently valid.

properties.name: statusReason
properties.short: online | paused | standby | offline | not-ready | transduc-discon | hw-discon | off
properties.definition: Reason for the dtatus of the Device availability.

properties.name: distinctIdentifier
properties.definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
properties.comment: For example, this applies to devices in the United States regulated under *Code of Federal Regulation 21CFRÂ§1271.290(c)*.

properties.name: manufacturer
properties.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

properties.name: manufactureDate
properties.short: Date when the device was made
properties.definition: The date and time when the device was manufactured.

properties.name: expirationDate
properties.short: Date and time of expiry of this device (if applicable)
properties.definition: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

properties.name: lotNumber
properties.definition: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

properties.name: serialNumber
properties.short: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer
properties.definition: The serial number assigned by the organization when the device was manufactured.
properties.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

properties.name: deviceName
properties.short: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer
properties.definition: This represents the manufacturer's name of the device as provided by the device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the Device.  This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.name: name
properties.definition: The name of the device.

properties.name: type
properties.short: udi-label-name | user-friendly-name | patient-reported-name | manufacturer-name | model-name | other
properties.definition:
The type of deviceName.
UDILabelName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName | ManufactureDeviceName | ModelName.

properties.name: modelNumber
properties.short: The model number for the device
properties.definition: The model number for the device.

properties.name: partNumber
properties.short: The part number of the device
properties.definition: The part number of the device.
properties.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

properties.name: type
properties.short: The kind or type of device
properties.definition: The kind or type of device.

properties.name: specialization
properties.short: The capabilities supported on a  device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication
properties.definition: The capabilities supported on a  device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication.

properties.name: systemType
properties.short: The standard that is used to operate and communicate
properties.definition: The standard that is used to operate and communicate.

properties.name: version
properties.short: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate
properties.definition: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate.

properties.short: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device
properties.definition: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device.

properties.name: type
properties.short: The type of the device version
properties.definition: The type of the device version.

properties.name: component
properties.short: A single component of the device version
properties.definition: A single component of the device version.

properties.name: value
properties.definition: The version text.

properties.name: property
properties.short: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties
properties.definition: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties.

properties.name: type
properties.short: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible)
properties.definition: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible).

properties.name: valueQuantity
properties.definition: Property value as a quantity.

properties.name: valueCode
properties.short: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP)
properties.definition: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP).

properties.name: patient
properties.short: Patient to whom Device is affixed
properties.definition: Patient information, If the device is affixed to a person.

properties.name: owner
properties.definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

properties.name: contact
properties.definition: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.
properties.comment: used for troubleshooting etc.

properties.name: location
properties.definition: The place where the device can be found.

properties.name: url
properties.definition: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.
properties.comment: If the device is running a FHIR server, the network address should  be the Base URL from which a conformance statement may be retrieved.

properties.name: note
properties.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

properties.name: safety
properties.definition: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device.  For example devices containing latex.

properties.name: parent
properties.definition: The parent device.

searchParameters.name: device-name
searchParameters.description: A server defined search that may match any of the string fields in Device.deviceName or Device.type.

searchParameters.name: identifier
searchParameters.description: Instance id from manufacturer, owner, and others

searchParameters.name: location
searchParameters.description: A location, where the resource is found

searchParameters.name: organization
searchParameters.description: The organization responsible for the device

searchParameters.name: patient
searchParameters.description: Patient information, if the resource is affixed to a person

searchParameters.name: udi-carrier
searchParameters.description: UDI Barcode (RFID or other technology) string in *HRF* format.
